text:
All of Andrias' power
comes from this music box,

so our best bet
is to get it away from him.
All right, friends, any ideas?
Remember, this is a safe space

full of chill vibes
and good intentions.

- ( laughs )
- What? I have an idea.

Let me guess, you want
to bash in the front door,

beat up anyone you see,
and take the music box?
Maybe.

Typical toad maneuver.
It'll never work.

Tritonio,
let's keep it positive.
All ideas are welcome here.
Even bad ones?

- Especially bad ones.
- Well, uh, I have an--

May I propose a more
intelligent approach?

We take a small strike force,
dress them up as orphans,

sneak past the guards,
and steal the box.

I'm not confident
that would succeed.

Andrias' security is top notch
and I don't think orphans

are going to trick
a bunch of soulless robots.

With the right orphan costume
you can trick anyone.

- It's proven.
- Ha!

Now who has bad ideas,
you cocky newt?

Anne:
Beatrix, that's not helping.
Right.
( clears throat )

Would anyone like
to hear my idea?

Ha! A frog with
a battle strategy?

Yes, yes, what is it?
Maybe paint a barn?
Have a hoedown?

- That's it!
- Ow!
( grunting )

Anne, this isn't working.
We need to do something.
You're right, Sash.
It's time for...
team-building exercises.
( crowd muttering )
Okay, folks, listen up.

In order to defeat King Andrias
and his robot hordes,
we need to work together.
First up is the mirror exercise.

I learned this one
at summer camp.

Everyone gather around
in a circle
and mimic my movements exactly.

Excuse me,
what's the point of this?

If it's to make us all
feel stupid, it's working.

This is all about harmony,
people.

Can you feel it?
Can you feel the harmony?
( all groan )
Aah!

Anne: Next up is the human knot,
or in this case,

the human-frog-toad-newt
knot thing.

Try to untangle yourselves
while holding hands.

- Got to twirl, Grimesy.
- Hmph.

Come on, toad,
figure it out.

Yeah, use that
big brain of yours.

- Argh!
- Aah!
( all yelling )

Anne: Next up,
the three-legged race.

- ( growls )
- Runners, on your mark,
get set...
( grunting )
Aah!

- Aah!
- Whoo!
Yes! Nailed it!

- ( yelling )
- Oh, no. Not again!
( all groaning )
Next, we have the trust fall.

This is the final step
to knowing

that you'll have each other's
backs out there.

- Now, when I say go--
- Go?
No!

Way to leave your armor on,
you dumb toad.

Well, you weaklings
were supposed to catch me.

Guys, remember, this is about
supporting each other.

Support? I got
your support right here.

- ( all gasping )
- Oh, jeez.

- Aah!
- Whoa!

- That does it!
- Oh, it's on.

Oh, my gosh, Anne,
this is a total disaster.

They're fine.
They're just blowing off steam.

I mean, at least
they don't have their weapons.

- Did somebody say weapons?
- ( cheering )

- That would make this better!
- No!

Weapon!
Take a weapon, leave a body.

No, wait!
Guys, we can talk about...
...this.
Newts, to me.
Toads, battle formation.

Come on, frogs!
Uh, do the best you can.

- No!
- Charge!
Enough!
I said, enough!

( clears throat )
Probably should've led
with the having powers thing.

All this time,
I thought I could solve

your problems
and heal this rift.

But I was wrong.
There is no quick fix.

I can't solve
this problem for you.

Only you can.
So when you're ready

to work together
and save the world,
let me know.
